channel.title: RS Music
channel.description:
I'm looking to, via BCEL, disable RS from playing that annoying song while the client is loading.
I know their must be a field somewhere, as we can turn it off by pressing the little "Sound Off" button in the bottom right of the screen.
I checked the only boolean in the 498 client, and it was incorrect.
Anyone with knowledge of this stuff or thinks they can help, please post.

item.title: RS Music
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:18, topic:209762”][quote author=BAsh link=topic=276233.msg2256978#msg2256978 date=1212384612]
Can we hook that? I want to try it out.
[/quote]Already have it.[/quote]
I had a good look at Animable and all its subclasses but I didn’t investigate the interfaces much. Nice: public int[][] getValueIndexArray();

Read full topic

item.title: RS Music
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

There are alternatives.

  1. There should be a method that actually plays the sound, and I’d think it would be fairly obvious from the libraries it uses. Hook that, and filter the sound you don’t want.

  2. There’s this button on your speakers…

Read full topic

item.title: RS Music
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

its not in the settings array, all values start at 0, and don’t change until you login

Read full topic

item.title: RS Music
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:11, topic:209762”]Get a piece of code iterating through the values.

Make a copy of it and then check the current version against the copy. If different tell the user the old value, new value and the index. Then write the change to the copy.

Then start the client and click mute. Surprise surprise you get the index.[/quote]Or you could check the interface component’s valueIndexArray[1]. It represents the storage in the settingsArray.

Read full topic

Make a copy of it and then check the current version against the copy. If different tell the user the old value, new value and the index. Then write the change to the copy.

Then start the client and click mute. Surprise surprise you get the index.[/quote]Good call.

I was actually working on something like this awhile ago. Only not for the SettingsArray.

Get a piece of code iterating through the values.

Make a copy of it and then check the current version against the copy. If different tell the user the old value, new value and the index. Then write the change to the copy.

Then start the client and click mute. Surprise surprise you get the index.

That is officially my least favorite array in the client.

[/quote]Care to elaborate?[/quote]
iterate it looking for the value?
